summary: The Sparking Production of Urban and Rural Housing Act (SPUR Housing Act) authorizes the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to establish a grant program for nonprofit housing organizations and community development financial institutions. These entities will provide financing, training, and technical assistance to "emerging developers" to undertake affordable housing and community development projects. The bill defines "emerging developers" and outlines criteria for grant applications and award priorities, particularly focusing on projects in distressed communities and high opportunity areas. It authorizes $50 million annually from 2026-2030.
